Custis-Lee Mansion
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Hadfield, George (American architect of English origin, born ca. 1763-1764, died 1826) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The mansion was built for Mary Custis Lee's father George Washington Parke Custis, step-grandson of George Washington and grandson of Martha Dandridge Custis Washington. In 1874 Secretary of State Edwin Stanton ordered that a national cemetery be formally established on the grounds. Established as the Robert E. Lee Memorial, 1928. -- Loth, Virginia Landmarks Register, 19999 [work]
